You have a bag of 50 red marbles and 50 blue marbles. Without looking, how many marbles do you need to take out of the bag to guarantee that you have at least 10 marbles of the same color?
Hint: Think carefully about the worst-case scenario.

To determine the number of marbles you need to take out to guarantee that you have at least 10 marbles of the same color, consider the worst-case scenario.

In the worst-case scenario, you could potentially pick out the maximum number of marbles without getting 10 of the same color. This would involve picking 9 red marbles and 9 blue marbles. At this point, you have a total of 18 marbles, but not yet 10 of the same color.

Therefore, the next marble you pick, whether it's red or blue, will give you 10 marbles of that color.

Thus, you need to take out a total of 19 marbles to guarantee that you have at least 10 marbles of the same color.
